content: A few of us mentioned portal network, light client, networking p2p stuff on the call â€” no pressure to create a project together but would be cool to have a study group and bounce ideas/resources of each other â€” send me a friend request if you want to create a study group!

author: chfast
content: I can drop some EVM project ideas tomorrow. Mark it if there is any interest.

author: __kasey__
content: I introduced myself on the call - just posting here so folks will have my discord handle. Feel free to ping me in particular if you would like to contribute to prysm, or need help with golang, or want to use packages from the prysm codebase in your project.

author: pavignol
content: Hi Kasey! I'm interested in working on Prysm, especially the Beacon API implementation. Are you the best person to contact or should I contact potuz directly? Also, where would you rather have people ask questions (DMs, here, prysm discord or the execution client channel)?

author: __kasey__
content: For that project I'd suggest myself or <@308223150725005322> who I believe is also signed up as a mentor and who built a lot of the existing API implementation. Posting here or prysm discord and tagging both of us would be the most effective, but feel free to DM as well.

author: markodayan
content:
Hi, anyone know about getting write-access to this repo? https://github.com/eth-protocol-fellows

My PR for writing to my note markdown file is getting blocked since I don't have write access

author: potuz
content: Some advice for the fellows: try not to merge your own PR, you're more likely to get a review, catch some typos/errors, and simply get someone to actually read it.

author: potuz
content: Ah but I may have been confused by the email and actually PRs are being required to be reviewed. Somehow I was tricked into believing several were being auto merged
